thread.title: quick question, how to cap a cone?

post.date: Posted: Tue Feb 08, 2005 9:42 pm Post subject: quick question, how to cap a cone?
post.author: bad marine ass
post.body: I'm pretty new to Lightwave (modelling in fact), but I'm slowly getting the hang of it. Anyway, my first object is the cue used in billards and pool. It was easy to get the shape, I made a cone then segmented using knife and cut off the top part. My question is, how do I cap the 2 ends of the cue? Is there a quick way or do I have to manually create a disc and slip it on to the two ends?

post.date: Posted: Tue Feb 08, 2005 9:45 pm Post subject:
post.author: xwarpedx
post.body:
you'd be better off using a capped cylinder and scaling the ends to the sizes you want.
_________________
I won't give up until their blood soaks my fingers...

post.date: Posted: Tue Feb 08, 2005 11:37 pm Post subject:
post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
In the perspective viewport select the points on a single end in a clockwise fashion and press p.
